metadata.title: CVE-2014-125007 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: A vulnerability classified as problematic was found in FFmpeg 2.0. Affectedby this vulnerability is the function intra_pred of the filelibavcodec/hevcpred_template.c. The manipulation leads to memorycorruption. The attack can be launched remotely. It is recommended to applya patch to fix this issue.

criterions.comment: ffmpeg: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was not-affected').
